questions.question: He always talks ......................................... his achievements.
questions.description: To talk down is to tell people that something is not important or interesting.

questions.question: He always talks ........................................... his competitors.
questions.description: Talk down can mean disparage or belittle.

questions.question: The boy seemed quite nervous but his mother talked him ............................................ by telling jokes.
questions.description: To talk somebody down is to calm them.

questions.question: We were given two hours to talk the offer ...................................... with our partners.
questions.description: To talk something over is to review it.

questions.question: She was against my idea but eventually I managed to talk her ....................................... to my view.
questions.description: To talk someone round is to persuade them to change their mind so that they agree with you.

questions.question: The husband and wife were told to talk ........................................... their differences.
questions.description: To talk out is to discuss.

questions.question: The woman threatened to commit suicide by jumping off the building but the police managed to talk her .......................................... it.
questions.description: To talk somebody out of something is to dissuade them from doing it.

questions.question: He wasn't keen on buying that overpriced jacket but the salesman talked him .............................................. buying it.
questions.description: To talk somebody into doing something is to persuade them to do it.

questions.question: The charming guy could easily talk his way .......................................... of trouble.
I talked ............................................. my concerns with my attorney.
questions.description: To talk over is to discuss.

questions.question: The teacher was angry because the student talked ........................................... to her.
questions.description: To talk back is to reply defiantly.
